title.en: Biographies of Wei Bao and Peng Yue
title.raw: 《魏豹彭越列傳》 Biographies of Wei Bao and Peng Yue

sentences.zh: 魏豹者，故魏諸公子也。

translations.literal: Wei Bao was a prince of the former state of Wei.

sentences.zh: 其兄魏咎，故魏時封為寧陵君。

translations.literal: His elder brother Wei Jiu had been enfeoffed as Lord of Ningling during the former Wei dynasty.

sentences.zh: 秦滅魏，遷咎為家人。

translations.literal: When Qin destroyed Wei, they demoted Wei Jiu to commoner status.

sentences.zh: 陳勝之起王也，咎往從之。

translations.literal: When Chen Sheng rose up to become king, Wei Jiu went to join him.

sentences.zh: 陳王使魏人周市徇魏地，魏地已下，欲相與立周市為魏王。

translations.literal: The King of Chen sent the Wei native Zhou Shi to pacify the Wei territories. After the Wei lands had submitted, they wanted to jointly establish Zhou Shi as King of Wei.

sentences.zh: 周市曰：「天下昏亂，忠臣乃見。

translations.literal: Zhou Shi said: 'World in chaos, loyal ministers then appear.
translations.idiomatic: Zhou Shi said: 'When the world is in chaos, loyal ministers make themselves known.

sentences.zh: 今天下共畔秦，其義必立魏王後乃可。」

translations.literal: Now world together rebel Qin, righteousness must establish Wei king descendant then permissible.'
translations.idiomatic: Now the whole world is rebelling against Qin together. For righteousness, we must establish a descendant of the Wei royal family to be permissible.'

sentences.zh: 齊、趙使車各五十乘，立周市為魏王。

translations.literal: Qi and Zhao sent chariots, each state providing fifty, and they wanted to jointly establish Zhou Shi as King of Wei.

sentences.zh: 市辭不受，迎魏咎於陳。

translations.literal: Zhou Shi declined the position and went to Chen to welcome Wei Jiu.

sentences.zh: 五反，陳王乃遣立咎為魏王。

translations.literal: After five attempts to persuade him, the King of Chen finally sent someone to establish Wei Jiu as King of Wei.

sentences.zh: 章邯已破陳王，乃進兵擊魏王於臨濟。

translations.literal: Zhang Han had already defeated the King of Chen, and then advanced his troops to attack the King of Wei at Linji.

sentences.zh: 魏王乃使周市出請救於齊、楚。

translations.literal: The King of Wei then sent Zhou Shi to go request rescue from Qi and Chu.

sentences.zh: 齊、楚遣項它、田巴將兵隨市救魏。

translations.literal: Qi and Chu sent Xiang Ta and Tian Ba to lead troops following Zhou Shi to rescue Wei.

sentences.zh: 章邯遂擊破殺周市等軍，圍臨濟。

translations.literal: Zhang Han then attacked, defeated, and killed Zhou Shi and his army, surrounding Linji.

sentences.zh: 咎為其民約降。

translations.literal: Wei Jiu negotiated surrender terms on behalf of his people.

sentences.zh: 約定，咎自燒殺。

translations.literal: Once the agreement was reached, Wei Jiu burned himself to death.

sentences.zh: 魏豹亡走楚。

translations.literal: Wei Bao fled to Chu.

sentences.zh: 楚懷王予魏豹數千人，復徇魏地。

translations.literal: The King of Chu gave Wei Bao several thousand men, and he once again pacified Wei territory.

sentences.zh: 項羽已破秦，降章邯。

translations.literal: Xiang Yu had already defeated Qin and accepted Zhang Han's surrender.

sentences.zh: 豹下魏二十餘城，立豹為魏王。

translations.literal: Bao took over twenty cities in Wei and was established as King of Wei.

sentences.zh: 豹引精兵從項羽入關。

translations.literal: [Basic: 豹引精兵從項羽入關.]

sentences.zh: 漢元年，項羽封諸侯，欲有梁地，乃徙魏王豹於河東，都平陽，為西魏王。

translations.literal: [Basic: 漢元年, 項羽封諸侯, 欲有梁地, 乃徙魏王豹於河東, 都平陽, 為西魏王.]

sentences.zh: 漢王還定三秦，渡臨晉，魏王豹以國屬焉，遂從擊楚於彭城。

translations.literal: [Basic: 漢王還定三秦, 渡臨晉, 魏王豹以國屬焉, 遂從擊楚於彭城.]

sentences.zh: 漢敗，還至滎陽，豹請歸視親病，至國，即絕河津畔漢。

translations.literal: [Basic: 漢敗, 還至滎陽, 豹請歸視親病, 至國, 即絕河津畔漢.]

sentences.zh: 漢王聞魏豹反，方東憂楚，未及擊，謂酈生曰：「緩頰往說魏豹，能下之，吾以萬戶封若。」

translations.literal: [Basic: 漢王聞魏豹反, 方東憂楚, 未及擊, 謂酈生曰："緩頰往說魏豹, 能下之, 吾以萬戶封若."]

sentences.zh: 酈生說豹。

translations.literal: [Basic: 酈生說豹.]

sentences.zh: 豹謝曰：「人生一世閒，如白駒過隙耳。

translations.literal: [Basic: 豹謝曰："人生一世閒, 如白駒過隙耳.]

sentences.zh: 今漢王慢而侮人，罵詈諸侯群臣如罵奴耳，非有上下禮節也，吾不忍復見也。」

translations.literal: [Basic: 今漢王慢而侮人, 罵詈諸侯群臣如罵奴耳, 非有上下禮節也, 吾不忍復見也."]

sentences.zh: 於是漢王遣韓信擊虜豹於河東，傳詣滎陽，以豹國為郡。

translations.literal: [Basic: 於是漢王遣韓信擊虜豹於河東, 傳詣滎陽, 以豹國為郡.]

sentences.zh: 漢王令豹守滎陽。

translations.literal: [Basic: 漢王令豹守滎陽.]

sentences.zh: 楚圍之急，周苛遂殺魏豹。

translations.literal: [Basic: 楚圍之急, 周苛遂殺魏豹.]

sentences.zh: 彭越者，昌邑人也，字仲。

translations.literal: [Basic: 彭越者, 昌邑人也, 字仲.]

sentences.zh: 常漁鉅野澤中，為群盜。

translations.literal: [Basic: 常漁鉅野澤中, 為群盜.]

sentences.zh: 陳勝、項梁之起，少年或謂越曰：「諸豪桀相立畔秦，仲可以來，亦效之。」

translations.literal: [Basic: 陳勝、項梁之起, 少年或謂越曰："諸豪桀相立畔秦, 仲可以來, 亦效之."]

sentences.zh: 彭越曰：「兩龍方鬬，且待之。」

translations.literal: [Basic: 彭越曰："兩龍方鬬, 且待之."]

sentences.zh: 居歲餘，澤閒少年相聚百餘人，往從彭越，曰：「請仲為長。」

translations.literal: [Basic: 居歲餘, 澤閒少年相聚百餘人, 往從彭越, 曰："請仲為長."]

sentences.zh: 越謝曰：「臣不願與諸君。」

translations.literal: [Basic: 越謝曰："臣不願與諸君."]

sentences.zh: 少年彊請，乃許。

translations.literal: [Basic: 少年彊請, 乃許.]

sentences.zh: 與期旦日日出會，後期者斬。

translations.literal: [Basic: 與期旦日日出會, 後期者斬.]

sentences.zh: 旦日日出，十餘人后，後者至日中。

translations.literal: [Basic: 旦日日出, 十餘人后, 後者至日中.]

sentences.zh: 於是越謝曰：「臣老，諸君彊以為長。

translations.literal: [Basic: 於是越謝曰："臣老, 諸君彊以為長.]

sentences.zh: 今期而多後，不可盡誅，誅最後者一人。」

translations.literal: [Basic: 今期而多後, 不可盡誅, 誅最後者一人."]

sentences.zh: 令校長斬之。

translations.literal: [Basic: 令校長斬之.]

sentences.zh: 皆笑曰：「何至是？

translations.literal: [Basic: 皆笑曰："何至是？]

sentences.zh: 請後不敢。」

translations.literal: [Basic: 請後不敢."]

sentences.zh: 於是越乃引一人斬之，設壇祭，乃令徒屬。

translations.literal: [Basic: 於是越乃引一人斬之, 設壇祭, 乃令徒屬.]

sentences.zh: 徒屬皆大驚，畏越，莫敢仰視。

translations.literal: [Basic: 徒屬皆大驚, 畏越, 莫敢仰視.]

sentences.zh: 乃行略地，收諸侯散卒，得千餘人。

translations.literal: [Basic: 乃行略地, 收諸侯散卒, 得千餘人.]

sentences.zh: 沛公之從碭北擊昌邑，彭越助之。

translations.literal: [Basic: 沛公之從碭北擊昌邑, 彭越助之.]

sentences.zh: 昌邑未下，沛公引兵西。

translations.literal: [Basic: 昌邑未下, 沛公引兵西.]

sentences.zh: 彭越亦將其眾居鉅野中，收魏散卒。

translations.literal: Peng Yue also led his forces to settle in the Ju marshes, gathering Wei's scattered soldiers.

sentences.zh: 項籍入關，王諸侯，還歸，彭越眾萬餘人毋所屬。

translations.literal: When Xiang Ji entered the pass and enfeoffed the various lords, upon his return, Peng Yue's force of over ten thousand men had no allegiance.

sentences.zh: 漢元年秋，齊王田榮畔項王，（漢）乃使人賜彭越將軍印，使下濟陰以擊楚。

translations.literal: In the autumn of the first year of Han, King Tian Rong of Qi rebelled against Xiang Yu. Han then sent someone to grant Peng Yue the seal of a general, ordering him to descend upon Jiyin to attack Chu.

sentences.zh: 楚命蕭公角將兵擊越，越大破楚軍。

translations.literal: Chu commanded Xiao Gongjiao to lead troops against Yue, but Yue greatly defeated the Chu army.

sentences.zh: 漢王二年春，與魏王豹及諸侯東擊楚，彭越將其兵三萬餘人歸漢於外黃。

translations.literal: In the spring of the second year of Han, together with King Bao of Wei and the various lords, they attacked Chu to the east. Peng Yue led his force of over thirty thousand men and submitted to Han at Waihuang.

sentences.zh: 漢王曰：「彭將軍收魏地得十餘城，欲急立魏後。

translations.literal: Han Wang say: Peng general gather Wei land obtain ten more cities, wish urgent establish Wei descendant.
translations.idiomatic: The Han king said: 'General Peng has gathered Wei territory and obtained over ten cities. I wish to urgently establish a descendant of Wei.

sentences.zh: 今西魏王豹亦魏王咎從弟也，真魏後。」

translations.literal: Now west Wei wang Bao also Wei wang Jiu younger brother, true Wei descendant.'
translations.idiomatic: Now King Bao of Western Wei is also a younger brother of King Jiu of Wei - a true descendant of Wei.'

sentences.zh: 乃拜彭越為魏相國，擅將其兵，略定梁地。

translations.literal: Thereupon he appointed Peng Yue as prime minister of Wei, giving him sole command of his troops to pacify the Liang region.

sentences.zh: 漢王之敗彭城解而西也，彭越皆復亡其所下城，獨將其兵北居河上。

translations.literal: When the Han king was defeated at Pengcheng and withdrew westward, Peng Yue again lost all the cities he had taken, and alone led his troops to dwell north of the river.

sentences.zh: 漢王三年，彭越常往來為漢游兵，擊楚，絕其後糧於梁地。

translations.literal: In the third year of Han, Peng Yue constantly moved about as Han's mobile forces, attacking Chu and cutting off their supply lines in Liang territory.

sentences.zh: 漢四年冬，項王與漢王相距滎陽，彭越攻下睢陽、外黃十七城。

translations.literal: In the winter of the fourth year of Han, while Xiang Yu confronted the Han king at Xingyang, Peng Yue attacked and took Suiyang and Waihuang - seventeen cities in total.

sentences.zh: 項王聞之，乃使曹咎守成皋，自東收彭越所下城邑，皆復為楚。

translations.literal: When Xiang Yu heard this, he had Cao Jiu guard Chenggao while he himself went east to recover the cities and towns Peng Yue had taken, restoring them all to Chu.

sentences.zh: 越將其兵北走穀城。

translations.literal: Yue led his troops north in flight to Gucheng.

sentences.zh: 漢五年秋，項王之南走陽夏，彭越復下昌邑旁二十餘城，得穀十餘萬斛，以給漢王食。

translations.literal: In the autumn of the fifth year of Han, while Xiang Yu fled south to Yangxia, Peng Yue again took over twenty cities around Changyi, obtaining over a hundred thousand dou of grain to supply the Han king with food.

sentences.zh: 漢王敗，使使召彭越并力擊楚。

translations.literal: After the Han king was defeated, he sent an envoy to summon Peng Yue to combine forces and attack Chu.

sentences.zh: 越曰：「魏地初定，尚畏楚，未可去。」

translations.literal: Yue say: Wei land just pacified, still fear Chu, not yet can go.
translations.idiomatic: Yue said: 'Wei territory has just been pacified. We still fear Chu - it is not yet possible to leave.'

sentences.zh: 漢王追楚，為項籍所敗碧陵。

translations.literal: The Han king pursued Chu but was defeated by Xiang Ji at Biling.

sentences.zh: 乃謂留侯曰：「諸侯兵不從，為之柰何？」

translations.literal: Then tell Liu Hou say: Various marquises troops not follow, for it what do?
translations.idiomatic: He then said to Liu Hou: 'The various lords' troops are not following. What can be done about it?'

sentences.zh: 留侯曰：「齊王信之立，非君王之意，信亦不自堅。

translations.literal: Liu Hou say: Qi wang Xin establish, not jun wang intention, Xin also not self firm.
translations.idiomatic: Liu Hou said: 'The establishment of King Xin of Qi was not Your Majesty's intention, and Xin himself is not firmly committed.

sentences.zh: 彭越本定梁地，功多，始君王以魏豹故，拜彭越為魏相國。

translations.literal: Peng Yue originally pacified Liang territory and has great merit. At the beginning, Your Majesty appointed Peng Yue as prime minister of Wei because of Wei Bao.

sentences.zh: 今豹死毋後，且越亦欲王，而君王不蚤定。

translations.literal: Now Bao is dead with no descendants, and moreover Yue also wishes to be king, yet Your Majesty has not decided early.

sentences.zh: 與此兩國約：即勝楚，睢陽以北至穀城，皆以王彭相國；

translations.literal: With this two countries agreement: If win Chu, Sui Yang north to Gu Cheng, all with wang Peng prime minister;
translations.idiomatic: Make this agreement with the two states: If we defeat Chu, from Suiyang north to Gucheng, all shall be enfeoffed to Prime Minister Peng as king.

sentences.zh: 從陳以東傅海，與齊王信。

translations.literal: From Chen eastward to the sea shall be given to King Xin of Qi.

sentences.zh: 齊王信家在楚，此其意欲復得故邑。

translations.literal: King Xin's family is in Chu - this is his intention to regain his old territory.

sentences.zh: 君王能出捐此地許二人，二人今可致；

translations.literal: Jun wang can give out discard this land grant two people, two people now can obtain;
translations.idiomatic: If Your Majesty can give up this territory and grant it to these two men, then both can be obtained now;

sentences.zh: 即不能，事未可知也。」

translations.literal: If cannot, matter not yet know.'
translations.idiomatic: If not, the outcome cannot be known.'

sentences.zh: 於是漢王乃發使使彭越，如留侯策。

translations.literal: Thereupon the Han king sent an envoy to Peng Yue, following Liu Hou's strategy.

sentences.zh: 使者至，彭越乃悉引兵會垓下，遂破楚。

translations.literal: When the envoy arrived, Peng Yue led all his troops to assemble at Gaixia, and they then defeated Chu.

sentences.zh: （五年）項籍已死。

translations.literal: In the fifth year, Xiang Ji was already dead.

sentences.zh: 春，立彭越為梁王，都定陶。

translations.literal: In spring, Peng Yue was established as King of Liang with his capital at Dingtao.

sentences.zh: 六年，朝陳。

translations.literal: In the sixth year, he paid court at Chen.

sentences.zh: 九年，十年，皆來朝長安。

translations.literal: In the ninth and tenth years, he all came to pay court at Chang'an.

sentences.zh: 十年秋，陳豨反代地，高帝自往擊，至邯鄲，徵兵梁王。

translations.literal: In the autumn of the tenth year, Chen Xi rebelled in Dai territory. Gao Di personally went to attack him, reaching Handan, and drafted troops from the King of Liang.

sentences.zh: 梁王稱病，使將將兵詣邯鄲。

translations.literal: The King of Liang claimed illness and sent his general to lead troops to Handan.

sentences.zh: 高帝怒，使人讓梁王。

translations.literal: Gao Di was angry and sent someone to reproach the King of Liang.

sentences.zh: 梁王恐，欲自往謝。

translations.literal: The King of Liang was afraid and wished to go personally to apologize.

sentences.zh: 其將扈輒曰：「王始不往，見讓而往，往則為禽矣。

translations.literal: His general Hu Zhe say: Wang beginning not go, see reproach then go, go then become captive.
translations.idiomatic: His general Hu Zhe said: 'Your Majesty did not go at first, but now that you see reproach and go, going will mean becoming a captive.

sentences.zh: 不如遂發兵反。」

translations.literal: Not like then raise troops rebel.'
translations.idiomatic: It would be better to simply raise troops and rebel.'

sentences.zh: 梁王不聽，稱病。

translations.literal: The King of Liang did not listen and claimed illness.

sentences.zh: 梁王怒其太仆，欲斬之。

translations.literal: [Basic: 梁王怒其太仆, 欲斬之.]

sentences.zh: 太仆亡走漢，告梁王與扈輒謀反。

translations.literal: [Basic: 太仆亡走漢, 告梁王與扈輒謀反.]

sentences.zh: 於是上使使掩梁王，梁王不覺，捕梁王，囚之雒陽。

translations.literal: [Basic: 於是上使使掩梁王, 梁王不覺, 捕梁王, 囚之雒陽.]

sentences.zh: 有司治反形己具，請論如法。

translations.literal: [Basic: 有司治反形己具, 請論如法.]

sentences.zh: 上赦以為庶人，傳處蜀青衣。

translations.literal: [Basic: 上赦以為庶人, 傳處蜀青衣.]

sentences.zh: 西至鄭，逢呂后從長安來，欲之雒陽，道見彭王。

translations.literal: [Basic: 西至鄭, 逢呂后從長安來, 欲之雒陽, 道見彭王.]

sentences.zh: 彭王為呂后泣涕，自言無罪，願處故昌邑。

translations.literal: [Basic: 彭王為呂后泣涕, 自言無罪, 願處故昌邑.]

sentences.zh: 呂后許諾，與俱東至雒陽。

translations.literal: [Basic: 呂后許諾, 與俱東至雒陽.]

sentences.zh: 呂后白上曰：「彭王壯士，今徙之蜀，此自遺患，不如遂誅之。

translations.literal: [Basic: 呂后白上曰："彭王壯士, 今徙之蜀, 此自遺患, 不如遂誅之.]

sentences.zh: 妾謹與俱來。」

translations.literal: [Basic: 妾謹與俱來."]

sentences.zh: 於是呂后乃令其舍人彭越復謀反。

translations.literal: [Basic: 於是呂后乃令其舍人彭越復謀反.]

sentences.zh: 廷尉王恬開奏請族之。

translations.literal: The Commandant of Justice, Wang Tian, submitted a memorial requesting that Peng Yue's entire clan be exterminated.

sentences.zh: 上乃可，遂夷越宗族，國除。

translations.literal: The emperor approved this, and Peng Yue's entire clan was exterminated while his state was abolished.

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：魏豹、彭越雖故賤，然已席卷千里，南面稱孤，喋血乘勝日有聞矣。

translations.literal: Grand Historian say: Wei Bao, Peng Yue though originally base, yet already rolled up thousand li, south face call solitary, bloodied ride victory day had heard.
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Historian says: Though Wei Bao and Peng Yue were originally of base status, they had already swept up a thousand li of territory, sat facing south and called themselves lords, their bloodied victories and triumphant advances were heard of daily.

sentences.zh: 懷畔逆之意，及敗，不死而虜囚，身被刑戮，何哉？

translations.literal: Cherish rebel treacherous intention, when defeated, not die but captive prisoner, body suffer execution, what?
translations.idiomatic: They harbored rebellious and treacherous intentions. When defeated, they did not die but were captured and imprisoned, their bodies subjected to execution. Why was this?

sentences.zh: 中材已上且羞其行，況王者乎！

translations.literal: Medium talent already above moreover ashamed their conduct, moreover wang master!
translations.idiomatic: Even those of middling talent and above would be ashamed of such conduct. How much more so for true kings!

sentences.zh: 彼無異故，智略絕人，獨患無身耳。

translations.literal: There was no other reason. Their wisdom and strategy surpassed others; they only suffered from lacking the proper status.

sentences.zh: 得攝尺寸之柄，其雲蒸龍變，欲有所會其度，以故幽囚而不辭云。

translations.literal: Once they obtained even a small measure of authority, they rose like clouds and dragons in transformation. They wished to find a place where their talents could be properly employed, which is why they endured imprisonment without declining.
